intro: Heeria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved heeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Heeria microphylla is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover due to its compact growth habit.
